ingredients.text: 1 pound of fresh fava beans, still in their pods
a couple glugs of olive oil
2 small yellow onions, peeled and left whole
2 to 3 sprigs fresh herbs (such as rosemary, thyme, or flat-leaf parsley)
1 to 1-1/2 cups dried beans, sorted through and rinsed
2 pounds small, tender green beans or yellow wax beans, trimmed
3 small dried red chiles (such as cayenne or chile de árbol)
1 pound black beans or pinto beans, washed and picked over for stones
2 1/2 cups of dry pinto beans (about 1 lb or 450gm)
2 Tbsp (or more to taste) pork lard, bacon fat, or olive oil (for vegetarian option)
1 pound (450g) dried white beans, sorted and rinsed
2 pounds mixed green beans and yellow wax beans
2 pounds mixed green beans and yellow wax beans
1 lb. dried white beans such as great northern, navy, or cannellini
1 ham hock, split, or about 1⁄2 lb. smoked pork necks, ham bone, or ham
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 teaspoons Black Pepper, More To Taste
2 1/2 lb haricots verts or other thin green beans, trimmed
1/2 teaspoon finely grated fresh lemon zest
1 bunch radishes , finely sliced into rounds
2 cups rio zappo beans(or pinto beans)cooked and drained
1 cup peeled, crushed ripe tomatoes, preferably plum tomatoes, with their juices
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 1/2 pounds romano beans (flat green beans), ends trimmed (or fresh cranberry beans in their shells).
One clove garlic, peeled and minced
2 medium onions, peeled and sliced thinly
500 grams (1 pound) fresh green beans, trimmed
½ a bunch of fresh mixed herbs, such as mint, basil
2 1/2 cup canned white beans (1 28 oz. can) drained and rinsed
1 onion, peeled and halved through core
-- Parsley or cilantro stems, thyme sprigs and/or oregano sprigs, tied with kitchen twine
1 teaspoon ancho chili powder, or other chili powder
1 (15-ounce) can pinto beans, preferably low-sodium, drained and rinsed
2/3 cup low-sodium chicken broth, plus more if needed
1 pound dried beans, such as cannellini beans, black beans, kidney beans, black-eyed peas, great northern beans or pinto beans
6 sprigs fresh thyme, or 1 teaspoon dried
1 pound dry Great Northern beans, soaked overnight (or using the quick soak method)
2 tablespoons olive oil or vegetable oil
2 medium yellow onions, diced small (about 2 cups)
1 1/2 teaspoons Dijon or spicy brown mustard
1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper (about 20 grinds)
4 ozs sliced bacon, cut into 1?2-inch pieces
1 lb dried navy beans, soaked in water overnight and drained
Coarse salt and freshly ground black pepper
Coarse salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 small yellow onion, peeled and finely chopped
1⁄4 lb. burnt ends or other barbecued meat scraps
2 lb green beans, stem ends trimmed
1 can of chili beans in sauce
3 cloves, garlic, one whole and two minced
1 head regular ol' green cabbage, shredded
1 cup yellow onion, slivered, we have the wonderfully sweet 1015 onions right now
1/2 cup hot banana pepper rings, drained
1 pound dried Corona beans (or other large white beans), soaked overnight in water to cover
2 or 3 large ripe tomatoes , diced (or one 14-ounce can peeled whole tomatoes )
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 pound dried black beans or pinto beans, rinsed
8 ounces orecchiette, radiatore or other short pasta

1/4 cup freshly grated Parmesan or Pecorino Romano cheese
2 cans black beans, rinsed, and mashed
1/2 cup firmly packed dark brown sugar
2 twenty-eight ounce cans red beans, drained and rinsed
3 sage leaves or 1 sprig rosemary or thyme
1 pound Great Northern beans, soaked at least 8 hours
4 cups dried aduki beans (or pinto or another type of beans)
4 slices preservative-free bacon, sliced into 1 inch pieces- optional; bacon lends a nice smoky saltiness but you can leave out for vegetarian beans
1 teaspoon course sea salt or to taste
1 teaspoon black pepper or to taste
1 teaspoon garlic powder or to taste

Freshly ground black pepper to taste

1 teaspoon minced fresh thyme (or 1/2 teaspoons dry thyme)

2 dozen ears of corn; shucked and silked
4 gallons half runner beans; strings removed and “broken” into 1-2” pieces

1 Tbsp vegetable oil (if not using the bacon fat, use 2 Tbsp vegetable oil)
